content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), Coastal Services Center (CSC)</origin> <pubdate>20140606</pubdate> <title>R-Factor for Alaska</title> <geoform>raster digital data</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Charleston, SC</pubplace> <publish>NOAA's Ocean Service, Coastal Services Center (CSC)</publish> </pubinfo> <othercit>Fletcher, Joel E.; Huber, A. Leon; Haws, Frank W.; and Clyde, Calvin G., "Runoff Estimates for Small Rural Watersheds and Development of a Sound Design method. Volume II, Recommendations for Preparing Design Manuals and Appendices B, C, D, E, F, G, & H" (1977). Reports. P 119.</othercit> <onlink>http://csc.noaa.gov/digitalcoast/tools/opennspect</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>The rainfall-runoff erosivity factor (R-Factor) quantifies the effects of raindrop impacts and reflects the amount and rate of runoff associated with the rain. The R-factor is one of the parameters used by the Revised Unified Soil Loss Equation (RUSLE) to estimate annual rates of erosion. This product is a raster representation of R-Factor derived from isoerodent maps published in the Runoff Estimates for Small Rural Watersheds and Development of a Sound Design method. Volume II. (Fletcher et al., 1977). Lines connecting points of equal rainfall erosivity are called isoerodents. The isoerodents plotted on a map of Alaska were digitized, then values between these lines were obtained by linear interpolation. The final R-Factor data are in raster GeoTiff format at 800 meter resolution in Albers Conic Equal Area,WGS84, WGS84.</abstract> <purpose>These data are represented in raster format for use with the Open source Nonpoint Source Pollution and Erosion Comparison Tool (OpenNSPECT).</purpose> <supplinf>These data are derived from isoerodent maps published in Runoff Estimates for Small Rural Watersheds and Development of a Sound Design method. Volume II. (Fletcher et al., 1977). Fletcher, Joel E.; Huber, A. Leon; Haws, Frank W.; and Clyde, Calvin G., "Runoff Estimates for Small Rural Watersheds and Development of a Sound Design method. Volume II, Recommendations for Preparing Design Manuals and Appendices B, C, D, E, F, G, & H" (1977). Reports. P 119.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>1965</begdate> <begtime>Unknown</begtime> <enddate>1975</enddate> <endtime>Unknown</endtime> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>ground condition</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None Planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>167.930127</westbc> <eastbc>-123.346463</eastbc> <northbc>71.406230</northbc> <southbc>52.510506</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>Environmental Monitoring</themekey> <themekey>R-Factor</themekey> <themekey>Rainfall-Runoff Erosivity</themekey> <themekey>Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation</themekey> <themekey>Erosion</themekey> <themekey>RUSLE</themekey> <themekey>RUSLE2</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>Alaska</placekey> <placekey>Coastal zone</placekey> <placekey>Alaska</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>None</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>GS (Geospatial Services) Program Manager</cntper> <cntorg>NOAA Coastal Services Center</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GS Program Manager</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype> <address>2234 S. Hobson Ave.</address> <city>Charleston</city> <state>SC</state> <postal>29405</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>843-740-1210</cntvoice> <cntfax>843-740-1224</cntfax> <cntemail>clearinghouse@noaa.gov</cntemail> <hours>8:00 am to 5:00 p.m. EST. M-F</hours> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <datacred>Acknowledgement of the NOAA Coastal Services Center and Fletcher et al., (1977) would be appreciated in products derived from these data.</datacred> <native>MapWindow GIS 8.x</native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>The cell values in this product represent R-Factor which is an erosivity index for rainfall and runoff. The units are (hundreds ft-tonf-in)/(ac-h-yr).</attraccr> </attracc> <logic>Tests for logical consistency indicate that all row and column positions in the selected latitude/longitude window contain data.  Conversion and integration with vector files indicates that all positions are consistent with earth coordinates covering the same area.</logic> <complete>All pixels within Alaska boundary contain R-Factor values.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar>This map is an approximation of spatial rainfall-runoff values</horizpar> </horizpa> <vertacc> <vertaccr>None</vertaccr> </vertacc> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srccite> <citeinfo> <origin>NOAA, National Ocean Service, Coastal Services Center</origin> <pubdate>Unknown</pubdate> <pubtime>Unknown</pubtime> <title>R-Factor for Alaska</title> <geoform>raster digital data</geoform> </citeinfo> </srccite> <srcscale>100000</srcscale> <typesrc>disc</typesrc> <srctime> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>1965</begdate> <begtime>Unknown</begtime> <enddate>1975</enddate> <endtime>Unknown</endtime> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <srccurr>Paper map</srccurr> </srctime> <srccitea>R-Factor</srccitea> <srccontr>Derived from isoerodent maps (Fletcher et al., 1977)</srccontr> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>The rainfall-runoff erosivity factor was estimated from the R-Factor map for Alaska given in Runoff Estimates for Small Rural Watersheds and Development of a Sound Design method. Volume II. (Fletcher et al., 1977). A line shapefile approximation of the printed map was generated via "heads-up" digitizing. The final raster map was produced using the Topo to Raster command in ESRI ArcGIS 10.x.</procdesc> <procdate>2014</procdate> <proccont> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>GS (Geospatial Services) Program Manager</cntper> <cntorg>NOAA Coastal Services Center</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GS Program Manager</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype> <address>2234 S.
